definitions.definition: propel (something) with force through the air by a movement of the arm and hand.
examples: I threw a brick through the window
synonyms: let fly with "she threw the ball back"

definitions.definition: push or force (someone or something) violently and suddenly into a particular physical position or state.
examples: the pilot and one passenger were thrown clear and survived

definitions.definition: put in place or erect quickly.
examples: the stewards had thrown a cordon across the fairway

definitions.definition: move (a part of the body) quickly or suddenly in a particular direction.
examples: she threw her head back and laughed

definitions.definition: project or cast (light or shadow) in a particular direction.
examples: a chandelier threw its bright light over the walls

definitions.definition: deliver (a punch).
examples: deliver, give, land he threw another punch

definitions.definition: direct (a particular kind of look or facial expression).
examples: she threw a withering glance at him
synonyms: shoot "she threw a withering glance at him"

definitions.definition: project (one's voice) so that it appears to come from someone or something else, as in ventriloquism.
put on or take off a garment hastily.
examples: I threw on my housecoat and went to the door

definitions.definition: move (a switch or lever) so as to operate a device.
roll (dice).
obtain (a specified number) by rolling dice.
lose (a race or contest) intentionally, especially in return for a bribe.
cause to enter suddenly a particular state or condition.
examples: he threw all her emotions into turmoil

definitions.definition: put (someone) in a particular place or state, especially in a rough, abrupt, or summary fashion.
examples: these guys should be thrown in jail

definitions.definition: disconcert; confuse.
examples: she frowned, thrown by this apparent change of tack

definitions.definition: send (one's opponent) to the ground in wrestling, judo, or similar activity.
(of a horse) unseat (its rider).
examples: unseat, dislodge the horse threw its rider

definitions.definition: (of a horse) lose (a shoe).
(of an animal) give birth to (young, of a specified kind).
examples: sometimes a completely black calf is thrown

definitions.definition: form (ceramic ware) on a potter's wheel.
examples: further on, a potter was throwing pots

definitions.definition: turn (wood or other material) on a lathe.
twist (silk or other fabrics) into thread or yarn.
have (a fit or tantrum).
give or hold (a party).
examples: give, host, hold, have, provide, put on, lay out, arrange, organize he threw a farewell party for them
